business.headline: Indian funds in Swiss banks triple, banking routes see sharpest surgeIndian funds in Swiss banks surged over threefold to CHF 3.5 billion (Rs 37,600 crore) in 2024, mainly due to a massive rise in holdings through financial institutions and banking channels. However, customer deposits rose by just 11%, making up only one-tenth of the total funds, which remain under tax scrutiny despite regular data sharing with Indian authorities.

Oil prices stable, situation not alarming: Union Minister amid Middle East tensionsUnion Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri allayed concerns about a spike in oil prices amid the Israel-Iran conflict, saying the situation was manageable and energy rates were under control.

Crashed Dreamliner well-maintained, next major check was due in Dec: Air India CEOAir India CEO Campbell Wilson on Thursday said that the Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, that crashed in Ahmedbad on June 12, was well maintained.

GST Council may replace compensation cess with 2 new levies: ReportIf approved, the dual cess structure could redefine how India funds health and green goals, but only if the Centre and states agree on who pays, who gains, and who decides.

Explained: How India's new gold loan rules will impact lendersThe RBI's directive requires a move towards cash flow-based credit assessments. This means lenders must go beyond just considering the gold's value as collateral.
Sensex ends 83 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; Adani Ports down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 82.79 points to end at 81,361.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 18.80 points to close at 24,793.25.

India's rice exports gain edge as Vietnam, Thailand face subdued markets: ReportIndia's rice supply remains strong, with government reserves reported at 59.5 million metric tonnes as of June 1. This figure is over four times the official target for July, highlighting the country's substantial rice stockpile.

Oswal Pumps IPO listing: Will it make a bumper debut? Check latest GMPOswal Pumps is set to debut on Dalal Street on June 19 with high investor expectations. The IPO of Oswal Pumps was oversubscribed by more than 34 times.

Karnataka plans 10-hour days for tech sector employees: ReportAt present, Section 7 of the Karnataka Shops and Commercial Establishments Act, 1961, limits working hours to nine per day, and allows a maximum of 10 hours of overtime in three months.

Your savings account is quietly robbing you, says financial advisorFinancial advisor Lovish Anand has issued a sharp reality check for Indian savers in a recent LinkedIn post titled: "Your Savings Account Is Quietly Robbing You."

Insured, but at what cost?Hospitals are turning into battlegrounds over pending claims, with policyholders watching their premiums shoot up faster than their salaries. Insurance is no longer the comforting shield it once was.

Is Rs 70 lakh per annum the new middle class? Investment banker explainsAre urban professionals struggling even with Rs 70 lakh income per year? A Gurugram-based investment banker breaks down where the money really goes.

entertainment.headline: China uses AI to revive 100 classic Kung Fu filmsChina is launching an AI-driven project to revive 100 classic martial arts films, including works by Bruce Lee and Jackie Chan, blending restoration with innovation for modern audiences and global appeal.

Anna Camp goes public with girlfriend Jade Whipkey at Bride Hard premiereAnna Camp made her red carpet debut with girlfriend Jade Whipkey at the Bride Hard premiere, confirming their relationship after months of speculation and celebrating her new film in Los Angeles.

No one can touch my children: Kajol on trolling and public scrutinyActor Kajol opened up about the social media trolling faced by star kids today. The actor, in an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, highlighted the importance of love and emotional strength in parenting amid constant criticism.

Sunil Grover mimics Salman Khan, Kapil Sharma says itna attitude. WatchSalman Khan will be the first guest on 'The Great Indian Kapil Show' Season 3, premiering June 21 on Netflix. A hilarious new promo featuring the superstar, Kapil Sharma, and Sunil Grover promises a laughter-packed start to the season.
Karisma Kapoor, Kareena-Saif at Sunjay Kapur's funeral in DelhiKarisma Kapoor, along with sister Kareena and Saif Ali Khan, were clicked at Lodhi crematorium in New Delhi for Sunjay Kapur's funeral.

Vijay Deverakonda, Rashmika avoid paps as they arrive together at airport. WatchActors Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna avoided paparazzi as they returned to Mumbai on June 19. A video of the two exiting airport has emerged online.

Host Sonali Bendre says Pati, Patni Aur Panga is like a page of my marriageSonali Bendre is making a comeback as a TV host for the upcoming reality show 'Pati, Patni Aur Panga', featuring real-life celebrity couples in fun relationship challenges. Calling it a reflection of her own marriage, she said the show celebrates everyday moments that make love real.

Kajol on working equation with husband Ajay Devgn: We are not civilisedKajol opened up about working with husband Ajay Devgn, sharing how they openly call each other out on set but never cross boundaries. She also said she keeps a polite and professional attitude while shooting to maintain a comfortable work environment.

Nani to reunite with Hi Nanna director Shouryuv for pan-India rom-com: ReportNani is set to reunite with 'Hi Nanna' director Shouryuv for a light-hearted romantic comedy. The shooting for the film is expected to begin in 2026.

Justin Baldoni acquires rights to read Blake Lively-Taylor Swift's private chatsIn a recent development in the 'It Ends With Us' row, actor-filmmaker Justin Baldoni acquired the rights to access messages between actor Blake Lively and her singer friend Taylor Swift. Here's what it means.

DNA review: Atharvaa-Nimisha's film is a smart thriller with few unwanted detoursReleased-Fri Jun 20, 2025DNA movie review: Director Nelson Venkatesan's film, starring Atharvaa and Nimisha Sajayan, is a neatly crafted thriller about organised crime. The film boasts enough thrills with a few unwanted detours.

Kajol calls Hyderabad's Ramoji Film City haunted, leaves internet dividedKajol's remarks about Ramoji Film City being haunted have stirred controversy among Hyderabadis and internet users. While some dismiss it as superstition, others recall similar spooky experiences at the iconic film studio.

Madonna reacts to ties with Pope Leo XIV; Jolie, Bieber also among his relativesSinger-songwriter Madonna responded to a recent report suggesting she is related to Pope Leo XIV. The report also mentioned that several other celebrities have ties to the Vatican.

Ahmed Khan cites Pahalgam attack, Kashmir schedule for Welcome to the Jungle delay'Welcome to The Jungle' director Ahmed Khan clarified that they were scheduled to shoot in Kashmir this month, but had to let go of the location in the aftermath of the Pahalgam attack. His statement came when several reports suggested financial issues as the reason behind the delay in the film's shooting.

Nani calls Meiyazhagan absolute beauty, one of his favourite films of the decadeActor Nani calls 'Meiyazhagan' an absolute beauty and one of his favourite films of the decade. The film's emotional depth and personal storytelling have left a lasting impact on him amidst big-budget cinema.

Mannara Chopra pays final respect to her father, holds his photo close at prayer meetThe prayer meet for Mannara Chopra's father was held on Thursday. The actor appeared heartbroken as she held his photo close while the family visited a Gurudwara for the ceremony.

I knew Thugs of Hindostan would fail but Aditya Chopra didn't agree: Aamir KhanAamir Khan recalls telling Aditya Chopra that their film 'Thugs of Hindostan' needed changes for it to work for the audience, but none of them agreed with his feedback. The actor explains what went wrong with the film.

Actor Rukmini Vasanth's "Tiger Tiger..." caption sparks collab rumours with Jr NTRDirector Prashanth Neel's upcoming film, tentatively titled 'NTR-Neel', starring Jr NTR is yet to reveal the rest of the cast. Ahead of this, an Instagram post by actor Rukmini Vasanth has gone viral for its caption, "Tiger Tiger Burning Bright", sparking rumours of her casting in the film.

Multiplex owners call Aamir visionary for theatre-only release of Sitaare Zameen ParActor Aamir Khan was praised by the Multiplex Association of India (MAI) for the theatre-only release of 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. The multiplex owners emphasised Aamir's bold move and his belief in the magic of cinema.

general news.headline: Iran fires missiles with cluster bombs as conflict with Israel enters day eightTensions continued to rise on Friday as Israel struck Iranian nuclear sites and Tehran responded with missiles armed with cluster munitions. Netanyahu says Israel is ahead in its campaign, while Trump weighs US support amid nuclear fears.

Live: Iran appoints new intel chief after Israeli strikes kill predecessorsIsrael-Iran Conflict Live Updates: Israel and Iran continued to launch several missiles at each other for the seventh consecutive day. In a live address, Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei declared that the nation remains united and will not bow to external pressure. Responding to US President Donald Trump's call for Iran to surrender, Khamenei issued a stern warning that any American military strike would lead to "serious irreparable consequences". Trump, on whether the US will attack Iran, said, "I may do it, I may not do it. I mean, nobody knows what I'm going to do." Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

New era. No mercy. Trail by Bazball awaits Shubman Gill's new-look IndiaEngland vs India, 1st Test preview: Shubman Gill will lead a new-look Indian side at Headingley, facing the daunting task of challenging a Bazballing England in their own backyard. The transition has been swift, offering no time to ease in. Can the young Indian side spring a surprise in Leeds?

Trump will decide on whether to attack Iran within 2 weeks: White HouseA day after reports claiming that Donald Trump has expressed support for plans to strike Iran but has yet to issue a final order, the White House on Thursday said that the US President will make a decision on whether to attack Iran within two weeks.

Khamenei's Khaybar tweet: A sword, a signal, a storyIran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei's tweet featured a digitally-illustrated painting: a luminous warrior gripping a double-bladed sword, flanked by two lions, striding toward a burning fortress under a rain of fire.

News Menu, June 20: PM to visit Bihar, Odisha; Israel-Iran conflict intensifiesIn today's News Menu: Iran-Israel conflict enters its eighth day, PM Modi is set to visit Bihar and Odisha, IMD clears cloud-seeding pilot project to combat air pollution in Delhi and Amit Shah's Chhattisgarh visit.

Shubhanshu Shukla-led Axiom-4 mission delayed again, no launch on June 22The Axiom-4 mission to the International Space Station has been postponed once again. NASA is standing down from a launch on Sunday, June 22, and will target a new launch date in the coming days.

India hit our airbases: Pakistan Deputy PM's big admission on Operation SindoorPakistan's Deputy PM Ishaq Dar confirmed that India struck key military bases -- Nur Khan and Shorkot -- during Operation Sindoor, in response to the Pahalgam terror attack. Dar also revealed that Saudi Arabia tried to calm tension by contacting India on Pakistan's behalf.

This Gulf War will BoomerangThe new Gulf war is a boomerang with worse aim than a drunk dart player and, like every misadventure from Kabul to Baghdad, is a masterclass in shooting your own foot while aiming for the moon.

Two-week window for Iran nuclear deal: UK Foreign Secretary ahead of Geneva talksUK Foreign Secretary David Lammy urged diplomacy with Iran, citing a two-week window for a nuclear deal, following White House talks and ahead of Geneva talks with EU and Iranian counterparts.

US quietly pulled military jets from Qatar airbase, satellite images showSatellite images show that the US removed most of its aircraft from Al Udeid Air Base in Qatar between June 5 and 19, amid rising tensions with Iran. Only three aircraft remained visible by June 19.

Oil prices stable, situation not alarming: Union Minister amid Middle East tensionsUnion Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri allayed concerns about a spike in oil prices amid the Israel-Iran conflict, saying the situation was manageable and energy rates were under control.

Gavaskar, Sachin, Dravid or Kohli: Who's India's best? Sherlock Holmes investigatesCricket meets mystery in this puzzle for the ages. Virat Kohli has just retired from Test cricket and touched off a debate on who's the best Test batter ever from the short list of Gavaskar, Tendulkar, Dravid and Kohli. It's a debate wrapped inside a mystery that has layers and layers of facts, data and emotions. So, the writer summons the Sherlok Holmes inside him to crack Open the case of the #FabFourDebate.

Iran could build nuclear bomb in a couple of weeks, says White HouseThe White House warned Iran could build a nuclear weapon within weeks if Ayatollah Khamenei approves. President Trump will decide in two weeks whether to strike Iran's underground Fordo facility.
Oil prices spike. Will rise more if US enters Israel-Iran frayBrent Crude prices jump as traders brace for conflict escalation, supply disruption, and geopolitical premium pricing.

The actor, in an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in, highlighted the importance of love and emotional strength in parenting amid constant criticism.

Cash row: These 'unnatural' behaviours of judge caught probe panel's attentionThe inquiry committee has found serious misconduct on the part of Justice Yashwant Varma, from whose residence a huge cash pile was found when a fire broke out there on March 14.

India must grin and bear Trump, US is bigger than one man's egoTrump has once again proved he is deaf to facts and blind to reality in claiming US credit for the India-Pakistan ceasefire. He seemingly twisted the knife with his 'I love Pakistan' comment soon after meeting Asim Munir. It's a red flag for Indian diplomacy, and for now, India must swallow this bitter pill. Because Trump is temporary.
Why small car sales are fallingOnce the dream of every middle-class household, the small car is vanishing—priced out by regulations, taxes, and changing tastes. Can affordability ever return?

Men block aisle to play cards on flight, viral video sparks outrageIn the viral video, a group of men blocked the aisle by tying a shawl across four seats, thereby creating a hammock-style surface on which to place their cards.

Language wars: Three-language formula or one-nation agenda? As states push back against Hindi imposition under the NEP, a deeper battle unfolds over linguistic identity, cultural diversity, and federal principles in Indian education.

Shashi Tharoor admits differences with Congress leadership amid campaign snubSenior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said that while there are occasional differences with the party leadership, these issues should be resolved internally.

Location for decoding crashed Air India plane's black box to be decided: GovernmentThe government said it would take a call on the location regarding the decoding of the black box of the doomed Air India plane in Ahmedabad after a thorough assessment from all angles by the AAIB.

Pathum Nissanka's 187 puts Sri Lanka in strong reply against BangladeshPathum Nissanka's sublime 187 lit up the third day in Colombo as Sri Lanka closed in on Bangladesh's total, keeping hopes alive for a strong comeback in the opening Test of the series.

ENG vs IND, Headingley Test: All you need to know about Gill era's debutENG vs IND: India and England begin a high-stakes five-Test series at Headingley, as Shubman Gill steps into leadership and Bazball faces its first home challenge against India after a crushing 4-1 defeat away earlier this year.

Solid in defence: New captain Gill quietly confident in England Test presserIndia tour of England: Speaking to the press for the first time as India's Test captain in England, Shubman Gill exuded quiet confidence. He offered just enough of a glimpse into his mindset to intrigue, but remained guarded while addressing tricky questions in Leeds on Thursday, June 19.

Shubman Gill calm and composed in first presser as Test captainIndia tour of England: It may not have matched the flamboyance of his one-day batting, but in his first press conference as Test captain in England, Shubman Gill exuded the quiet confidence of a man ready for the long haul-prepared for the patience and grind that the traditional format demands.

Play bazball, but adapt better: Ben Stokes's message to England for India TestsEngland skipper Ben Stokes backed the team's Bazball approach ahead of the India series but stressed the need for situational adaptability, urging his players to stay fearless while also adjusting to conditions across the five-match Test battle.

Shubman Gill unfazed by captaincy pressure: Want to be best batter vs EnglandShubman Gill steps into a new role as India's Test captain, aiming to lead with the bat and mindset as the five-match England series kicks off at Headingley, marking a fresh chapter in Indian cricket.

ISL organisers tell clubs 2025-26 season won't start with out MRA status clarityThe Indian Super League organisers have told the clubs that the 2025-26 season won't start without clarity in the Master Rights Agreement (MRA) signed with the AIFF, according to reports.

Don't worry about outside noise: Tendulkar tells India captain GillSachin Tendulkar told Shubman Gill to forget about outside noise and back the decisions he would make ahead of his first Test match as the captain of the Indian team. Gill will start his tenure with the Headingley Test.

Winning Test series in England bigger than lifting IPL trophy: Shubman GillIndia tour of England: Newly-appointed captain Shubman Gill stressed the importance of Test cricket, adding that his job will be to create a secure and positive dressing room. Gill remained guarded, not willing to reveal the team's combination on the eve of the first Test at Headingley, Leeds.

Gill reveals advice from Kohli and Rohit for England Test challengeShubman Gill said that he had chats with Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma during the IPL to get ready for the England tour. Gill is set to lead India in the new era after Rohit and Kohli's retirement from Tests.

Nico Williams and Barcelona reach verbal deal, salary talks remain: ReportsBarcelona have reportedly secured a six-year agreement with Nico Williams, signaling a major summer coup. The Spain international is now expected to form a lethal wide pairing with Lamine Yamal under new manager Hansi Flick.

Sachin Tendulkar's 3-point advice to Indian team before start of England seriesSachin Tendulkar gave some advice to the Indian team and pointed out the three key factors they should keep in mind ahead of the first Test against England, starting from Friday, June 20. India are set to start a new era under Shubman Gill's captaincy.

India a tough challenge without even Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma: Ben StokesEngland captain Ben Stokes downplayed the absence of India's senior stars, warning that the visitors remain a strong side ahead of the five-Test series under new skipper Shubman Gill, with Jasprit Bumrah leading the bowling attack.

Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy unveiled as legends pose with new silverwareSachin Tendulkar and James Anderson unveiled the new 'Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy' for the India-England Test series. The trophy replaces the Pataudi Trophy, marking a new era in the cricket rivalry between the two nations.

What gave Ollie Pope the edge over Jacob Bethell in No.3 race? Ben Stokes revealsEngland captain Ben Stokes explained the key factor that gave Ollie Pope the edge over Jacob Bethell in the race for the No.3 spot for the first Test against India. Pope scored 171 in his last knock against Zimbabwe during the one-off Test.

Take your time: Gill gets advice from Shastri ahead of captaincy bowFormer India coach Ravi Shastri had some key advice for Shubman Gill ahead of his first match as the captain of the Indian Test team. Gill is taking over from Rohit Sharma as the skipper of the Indian Test team.

Pataudi legacy must live on: Sachin Tendulkar on renaming IND vs ENG trophyIndia and England have contested the 'Pataudi Trophy' since 2007. However, starting from the 2025 series, the trophy has been rebranded as the 'Anderson–Tendulkar Trophy'. The batting great has responded to the name change, which has sparked debate within the cricketing community.

RCB's maiden title win makes IPL 2025 final most-watched T20 matchThe IPL 2025 final between RCB and Punjab Kings made history, becoming the most-watched T20 match ever as Royal Challengers Bengaluru lifted their first title after 18 years, setting massive records across TV and digital platforms.

Gill walks the talk, primed to take international stage by storm: KirstenGary Kirsten has heaped praise on Shubman Gill and feels the new India Test captain is a player who walks the talk and is primed to take the international stage by storm. Gill is ready for his first assignment as captain of the Indian Test team.

A dressing room without Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma will feel strange: KL RahulIndia tour of England: KL Rahul said India will miss the experience of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in the five-Test series, starting June 20. The star batter said the young team in Old Blighty will step up and deliver in the absence of the stalwarts.

Indian football body drops ISL from 2025-26 calendar, future of league in doubtThe All India Football Federation has excluded the Indian Super League from its 2025–26 calendar. This move follows uncertainty over the Master Rights Agreement and pending Supreme Court decisions, casting doubt on the league's future.

If Shubman Gill shows white-ball form at No.4, the world is his oyster: KarthikIndia tour of England: Dinesh Karthik said that if Shubman Gill can replicate his white-ball form at the No.4 spot, then the world would be his oyster. Gill will take over as India's new No.4 in Test cricket after the retirement of Virat Kohli.

Gautam Gambhir will enjoy working with a young captain: Sanjay ManjrekarIndia tour of England: Sanjay Manjrekar believes that Gautam Gambhir will enjoy working with a young captain in Shubman Gill and expects him to bring out results as he has done with the T20I side alongside Suryakumar Yadav.

WTC 2025-27: Who will play the most Tests in new cycle?South Africa clinched the World Test Championship 2023 title with remarkable resilience. Their low number of Test matches has triggered controversy amongst cricket fans.

Test cricket aspirations? Tilak Varma signs County deal with HampshireYoung India batter Tilak Varma has signed with Hampshire for four County Championship matches. His stint coincides with India's ongoing Test series in England.

Jose Mourinho vs Turkish FA: Fenerbahce demand investigation after leaked textsTurkish club Fenerbahce has called for the investigation of the Turkish FA after the alleged leaked WhatsApp messages, which involve Jose Mourinho. It is reported that several members of the organisation have already resigned.

Al-Hilal hold Real Madrid to 1-1 draw, Man City, Juve notch winsSimone Inzaghi's Al-Hilal managed to scrape a point with a draw against Xabi Alonso's Real Madrid in the biggest upset in the Club World Cup so far. Meanwhile, both Manchester City and Juventus start off their campaign with impressive wins as well.

Ben Stokes' warning for India: England do not fear Jasprit BumrahEngland Test captain Ben Stokes has said his team does not fear India's Jasprit Bumrah. He emphasised that winning a Test series depends on the entire team, not just one bowler.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
